abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impact
            are substantial. Lessons convey that overall development
            impact is attained by a sustained support: the decision to
            allocate the financial resources in two main sectors of a
            province for a rather long period of time, benefited all
            five districts of the provinces, and helped strengthen the
            institutional capacity at the central and provincial
            government levels. Moreover, the Bank's sustained
            involvement, and support to the province contributed to
            developing a strong working relationship with the local
            authorities, attracting further donors to the province.
            Although integrated provincial development projects are
            effective means to strengthen decentralization, the
            insufficient transfer of resources from central government
            however, limited mobilization of local revenues, resulting
            in inefficient allocation of resources across, and within
            the road, water and sanitation sectors. Thus, concrete steps
            need to be taken to increase the transparency of the funds
            being transferred, to improve reliability of transfers in
            terms of timing and amount, and, to enhance planning and
            decision making capacity at the provincial level.
            Implementation arrangements should be responsive to the
            sectors characteristics and needs, since as in this project,
            central, and provincial governments were not satisfied with
            the implementation arrangements, and did not see the
            relevance on the project coordination unit, nor the
            technical assistance provided by foreign consultants. The
            government proposed, and the Bank agreed, that the line
            units of the provincial office would carry out all
            implementation activities, institutional adjustments that
            improved management, and inter sector coordination.
